department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
description: Immersion Situational awareness courses are a training tool to help military personnel prepare for conflict. These courses allow participants to experience real-world scenarios in a controlled environment. The goal of these courses is a to develop critical thinking and decision-making skills for military personnel. The training includes interactive and immersive role-plays  The courses are tailored to the specific needs of each unit and provide training for personnel at all levels of the military from junior NCOs to General officers. The number of courses is flexible, and the location and either 5 or 7 days training. Duration of the course is 5-7 days. The course can be lengthened to include longer periods of training.

**Immersive Situational Awareness Training**
================================计
**Notice Reference**: PW_KIN_519_8711
**Publication Date**: 2022-11-28
**Tender Closing Date**: 2022-12-14T14:00:00
**Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
**Commodity/Service**: Business Training (SRV)
**Trade Agreements**: CETA/WTO-AGP/CPTPP/CFTA/FTAs with Peru/Colombia/Panama/Korea/UK
**Regions of Delivery**: Ontario (except NCR)

### Overview
Public Works and Government Services Canada, on behalf of the Department of National Defence, intends to issue a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the provision of Immersive Situational Awareness Training (ISAT) services.

### Description of Requirement
The Department of National Defence requires a Contractor to provide a 5-7 day ISAT course with instructors and an appropriate number of Role Players. The training will be conducted in an area within the corridor from the National Capital Region (NCR) to the Greater Toronto Area (GTA).

### Proposal Submission Requirements
Only holders of Supply Arrangement W6399-21J415 who are pre-qualified for category 7 will be emailed the RFP. Interested bidders must qualify for the Supply Arrangement before submitting a proposal.

### RFP Details

* Bid Submission Deadline: 2022-12-14T14:00:00
* Contact Person: Choquette, Herb at herb.choquette@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca or (613) 449-8446
* Tender Documents: Available at CanadaBuys or Collective Military Training role players and facilities

### Abled Submission Guidelines
Bidders may submit their proposals in either official language of Canada. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

### Notice
Prior to submitting a bid, all potential bidders must ensure they have the necessary permissions and licenses to operate in the supply of ISAT services. The Contractor must provide all necessary venues and infrastructure in support of the training. All participants will be DND Military Personnel.
